utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is taking a jar of olives out of the fridge.]

utterances.transcript: Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of olives?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of olives?

utterances.transcript: I won't give you anything, but you'll owe me 2.95.
Done.
Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!

utterances.transcript: Why? Do you have a report due?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?

utterances.transcript: I have a date with this diplomat I met while I was giving free massages outside the UN and, I don't know where his country is.
Okay, let's start with the free messages outside the UN.
Oh!! That's my new thing. I figure bodies at peace, make peace.
Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what country is this guy from?
Ick-neck-tree-anis..... There's a 'g' in there.
Where's that?
In your atlas!
I don't have an atlas.
Oh.
Oh, but wait I do have a globe.
Oh.
Hold on.
So Pheebs what's this guy like?
Umm, well he's very dashing, y'know, and umm, very, very sophisticated, and he doesn't speak any English, but according to his translator, he totally gets me.
'Kay, here you go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: 'Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)

utterances.transcript: What is this?
It's a globe and, a pencil sharpener.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Phoebe puts the globe right up next to her eye to try and find the country.)

utterances.transcript: Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I'm going down to the Xerox place.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I'm going down to the Xerox place.

utterances.transcript: Oh, no thanks.
Okay listen, just give me anything I can make two of.
Well, if you don't have anything to copy, why are you going down there?
Yeah, are you just going down there to gawk at that hot girl with the belly button ring again?
Yeah! You wanna come?
Yeah!

utterances.transcript: Hey, y'know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did Chloe say we should be there?
What time is it now?
Yeah all right, so we'll hang out.
Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?
Yes. Vividly.
She was kidding about that right?
Yeah, I-I-I think so. Yeah, I-I think so...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, I-I-I think so. (Pauses and thinks about it for a second) Yeah, I-I think so...

utterances.transcript: God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?
Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?
Dude, I don't know.
She was kidding.
Yeah.
She was.... But y'know what, just in case, maybe we should come up with a set of ground rules.
Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your eyes. Y'know, because you don't want to be doing something and then look up and see something you don't want to be seeing.
Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are closed, and, and my hand is out there....
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are closed, and, and my hand is out there.... (holds his arm out and pretends to grab something with his hand.)

utterances.transcript: Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we... y'know each would, y'know be?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we... (clears throat) y'know each would, (clears throat again) y'know (pause) be?

utterances.transcript: Right. Right. Well ah, y'know we could flip for it.
Yeah, I guess, but what's like heads and what's tails?
Well it you don't know that, then I don't want to do this with you.

utterances.transcript: Hi!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, carrying a basket) Hi!

utterances.transcript: Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (startled) Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?

utterances.transcript: Well you said you couldn't go out so....
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well you said you couldn't go out so.... (pulls the cover off of the basket)

utterances.transcript: You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That's it, on Monday I start wearing make-up.
Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.
Yeah, but I got cous-cous!
Honey, honey, I'm sorry, I know it's our anniversary but I told you on the phone I don't have time to stop.
Okay, you don't have to stop, I'm invisible, I'm not here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, you don't have to stop, I'm invisible, I'm not here. (lights a candle)

utterances.transcript: But I don't, hmm... Oh, who approved that order?! Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. Get me Mark on the phone!
utterances.transcript_with_note: But I don't, hmm... (on phone) Oh, who approved that order?! (listens) Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. (to Sophie) Get me Mark on the phone!

utterances.transcript: I love Mark. Do you know Mark?
utterances.transcript_with_note: I love Mark. (to Ross) Do you know Mark?

utterances.transcript: Yeah!!
Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is not the number for this store, 038 is Atlanta. And I...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is not the number for (Ross starts making a lot of noise with a handheld pepper grinder) this store, 038 is Atlanta. And I...(stops and looks at Ross)

utterances.transcript: Pepper?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stopping grinding) Pepper?

utterances.transcript: None for me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (angrily) None for me.

utterances.transcript: Okay sorry, whew.
I'm sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I'm sorry but that's... Oh my God!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I'm sorry but that's... (notices a fire that Ross's candle has started) Oh my God!!

utterances.transcript: Okay, that's a fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (putting out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water) Okay, that's a fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, I'm sorry, I'm gonna have to call you back, I've got a Schemp in my office. What are you doing?

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody's off the phone, how 'bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier...
No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.
I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (throws her stuff down) I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to me.

utterances.transcript: For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?
You had no right coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring a picnic basket to somebody's work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!
Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our anniversary, boy what an ass am I.
But I told you, I didn't have the time!
Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don't feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.
Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my job so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?
No, but it'd be nice if you realised, it's just a job!
Just a job!
Yes.

Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I'm doing something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I'm doing something that I'm actually good at. I mean. if you don't get that...
No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I'm happy for ya, but I'm tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I don't know what to do anymore.
Well neither do I!
Is this about Mark?
Oh my God.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shocked) Oh my God.

utterances.transcript: Okay, it's not, it's not.
Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again, Ross, no, you're, you're, you're making this too hard.
Oh I'm, I'm making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to do.
I don't know, I don't know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take a break.
Okay, okay, fine, you're right. Let's ah, let's take a break, let's cool off, okay, let's get some frozen yogart, or something..
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, okay, fine, you're right. Let's ah, let's take a break, (goes to the door) let's cool off, okay, let's get some frozen yogart, or something.. (opens the door)

utterances.transcript: No. A break from us.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is lying in front of the bay window, and the phone rings.]

utterances.transcript: Hello!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (jumping up to answer the phone) Hello!

utterances.transcript: Oh, hi. It's Mark.
Oh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (disappointed) Oh.

utterances.transcript: What? Is it my breath?
No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!
Hi. Well, look, I was just gonna leave a message, isn't tonight your, your big anniversary dinner?
Yeah. Well, umm.....
Rach, are you okay?
Yeah, I'm fine.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on the verge of tears) Yeah, I'm fine.

utterances.transcript: You wanna talk, I mean I can come over?
No! Really, no, please, please, that's, that's okay.
All right, all right, I'm coming over, and I'm bringing Chinese food.
Oh, yeah, I'm not, I'm not hungry.
It's for me.
Oh. Okay, bye.

utterances.transcript: Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful. I told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted to take a break, I don't want to take a break.

No. And then I called him, and he wasn't there.

utterances.transcript: Well, then he's, he's probably just, out.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Restaurant, after dinner.]

utterances.transcript: And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away, while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away, while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.

utterances.transcript: Oh. Can I have a tissue?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?

utterances.transcript: Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don't accidentally suck it up through your nose and choke on it.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Sergei says something to Mischa.)

utterances.transcript: Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Phoebe) Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.

utterances.transcript: Well, tell him, apology accepted.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Mischa does so.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, he's unbelievable. I mean for the first time in three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let me enjoy that, no!! You silly diplomat, why don't you learn some English, Sergei?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) Oh, he's unbelievable. I mean for the first time in three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let me enjoy that, no!! (to Sergei) You silly diplomat, why don't you learn some English, Sergei?

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, but umm, isn't he paying for your dinner?
Hey, the man's dog just died.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Sergei insults Mischa, and they get into a huge fight, in Russian.)

utterances.transcript: I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.

utterances.transcript: It will be my pleasure. My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy can't even say coupons.
utterances.transcript_with_note: It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy can't even say coupons. (they leave)

utterances.transcript: Uh, plate?
